abstract: Keeping terrorist threats out of science journals, pushing back against Politifact and Hollywood goes all in on a holiday gamble.
snippet: Keeping terrorist threats out of science journals, pushing back against Politifact and Hollywood goes all in on a holiday gamble.
lead_paragraph: The National Science Advisory Board for Biosecurity has asked two journals, Science and Nature, to keep out details of certain research from articles they plan to publish about the spread of a deadly flu virus. The virus normally doesn’t travel from person to person, but scientists managed to make a highly transmissible form (at least in ferrets, which provide a good model of what viruses will do in people). The government board fears the information could be used by terrorists to create deadly viruses and touch off epidemics.

abstract: Fees for sports programming keep going up, in part because fans are so loyal. And a recent ruling against Comcast could pave the way for more sports channels. Where will it all end?
snippet: Fees for sports programming keep going up, in part because fans are so loyal. And a recent ruling against Comcast could pave the way for more sports channels. Where will it all end?
lead_paragraph: The battle between sports programming and cable providers continues to heat up. Are consumers on the losing team?

headline.main: Sports, It Seems, Explains Recent Skirmishes in Cable Industry
